DOC.detailed_description: Transradial approach ( TRA ) cardiac catheterization percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) increasingly use worldwide elective emergency procedure reduce net adverse clinical event , reduction major bleed all-cause mortality , compare transfemoral approach . However , radial artery occlusion ( RAO ) procedure ( incidence vary 1 % 10 % ) remain one major limitation TRA . The aim study assess superiority verapamil versus heparin access success transradial percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) . METHODS Patients refer cath-lab Cardiovascular Institute University Hospital Ferrara , Italy , coronary angiography randomize 2 group computer-generated random sequence . The study double-blind . In first group , patient receive intravenous heparin ( 5000 UI ) immediately 6 F sheath insertion . In second group , patient receive Verapamil ( 5 mg ) immediately 6 F sheath insertion . If start procedure radial artery spasm ( RAS ) occur , operator choose use bail-out local vasodilator therapy . After sheath removal , hemostasis obtain use TR band ( Terumo corporation , Tokyo , Japan ) plethysmography-guided patent hemostasis technique . Radial artery patency evaluate 24 hour ( early RAO ) 30 day procedure ( late RAO ) ultrasound .
